Destiny Church member Ashara Kingi jailed for stealing $377,000 from her employer https://www.nzherald.co.nz/bay-of-plenty-times/news/destiny-church-member-ashara-kingi-jailed-for-stealing-377000-from-her-employer/NECY5JDQUFFTNAUVF6TGSSQ6GM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/bay-of-plenty-times/news/destiny-church-member-ashara-kingi-jailed-for-stealing-377000-from-her-employer/NECY5JDQUFFTNAUVF6TGSSQ6GM/ Sandra Conchie'She was a good actor who portrayed herself as a good Christian woman.' Fri, 26 Apr 2024 17:00:00 +0000 Destiny Church member Ashara Jaymie Kingi, 33, was sentenced to two years and two months jail after stealing $377,167.92 from her employer Larry John O'Neill while employed part-time as his bookkeeper.

Defence Force crisis: Briefings say Navy ‘extremely fragile’ as three ships remain in care of civilians https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/defence-force-crisis-briefings-say-navy-extremely-fragile-as- Three-ships-remain-in-care-of-civilians/62RSDDCNZVCM5FMPP3SCND76CA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/defence-force-crisis-briefings-say-navy-extremely-fragile-as- Three-ships-remain-in-care-of-civilians/62RSDDCNZVCM5FMPP3SCND76CA/ George Block, David FisherLike the Navy, the Army and Air Force are also in troubled waters, new briefings reveal. Fri, 26 Apr 2024 17:00:00 +0000 HMNZS Canterbury was out of action during the cyclone season amid staffing woes, while the ageing Seasprite helicopters the ship can carry have a plunging mission readiness rate.
